required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Recombinant Human Insulin-Like Growth Factor (rhIGF-1) Treatment of Short Stature Associated With IGF-1 Deficiency
clinical_study.official_title: Recombinant Human Insulin-Like Growth Factor (rhIGF-1) Treatment of Short Stature Associated With Primary IGF-1 Deficiency: A Multi-Center, Open Label, Concentration-Controlled Study

brief_summary.textblock: This study is intended to assess the effects of once daily dosing of recombinant human insulin-like growth factor (rhIGF-1) in increasing height velocity.

detailed_description.textblock:
Growth failure associated with primary IGF-1 deficiency (IGFD). Primary IGFD is a term that has been used to describe patients with intrinsic cellular defects in growth hormone (GH) action. In this protocol, primary IGFD is defined as short stature (<-2 standard deviations [SDs] below the mean for age and gender), and abnormal serum IGF-1 (<-2 SDs below the mean for age and gender).
The trial is an open-label, concentration-controlled trial conducted at up to 20 centers throughout the United States.

primary_outcome.measure: Height Velocity Over the Study Period 0 - 34 Weeks [Intent to Treat Population]
primary_outcome.description: Height to be measured standing without shoes as the average of three measurements by the same observer using identical technique with a Harpenden or other wall mounted stadiometer. Reposition subject between each measurement.

primary_outcome.measure: Height Velocity Over the Study Period 34 - 86 Weeks [Intent to Treat Population]
primary_outcome.description: Height to be measured standing without shoes as the average of three measurements by the same observer using identical technique with a Harpenden or other wall mounted stadiometer. Reposition subject between each measurement.

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in Height Standard Deviation (SD) Score Over the Study Period 0 - 34 Weeks [Intent to Treat Population]
secondary_outcome.description: Height to be measured standing without shoes as the average of three measurements by the same observer using identical technique with a Harpenden or other wall mounted stadiometer. Reposition subject between each measurement. Please note that Standard Deviation (SD) Score is a term used in growth studies. The SD Score is calculated as the patient value minus the mean divided by the standard deviation. The mean and the standard deviation vary depending on the age and sex of the child.

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in Height Standard Deviation (SD) Score Over the Study Period 34 - 86 Weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Height to be measured standing without shoes as the average of three measurements by the same observer using identical technique with a Harpenden or other wall mounted stadiometer. Reposition subject between each measurement. Please note that Standard Deviation (SD) Score is a term used in growth studies. The SD Score is calculated as the patient value minus the mean divided by the standard deviation. The mean and the standard deviation vary depending on the age and sex of the child.

secondary_outcome.measure: Bone Age - Change From Pretreatment Minus Change in Chronological Age Over the Study Period 0 - 86 Weeks [Intent to Treat Population]
secondary_outcome.description: Plain X-rays of the left hand and wrist exposed for bone age appraisal. The films are sent to a central facility for standardized evaluation.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percent Changes in Serum Concentration of Insulin-like Growth Factor Binding-1 (IGFBP-1) From Baseline to Week 86
secondary_outcome.description: Blood sample was collected while subject is in a fasting state for measuring the level of IGFBP-1 in the growth factor panel.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percent Changes in Serum Concentration of Insulin-like Growth Factor Binding-2 (IGFBP-2) From Baseline to Week 86
secondary_outcome.description: Blood sample was collected while subject is in a fasting state for measuring the level of IGFBP-2 in the growth factor panel.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percent Changes in Serum Concentration of Insulin-like Growth Factor Binding-3 (IGFBP-3) From Baseline to Week 86
secondary_outcome.description: Blood sample was collected while subject is in a fasting state for measuring the level of IGFBP-3 in the growth factor panel.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percent Changes in Serum Concentration of Acid Labile Subunit (ALS) From Baseline to Week 86
secondary_outcome.description: Blood sample was collected while subject is in a fasting state for measuring the level of Serum Concentration of Acid Labile Subunit (ALS).

secondary_outcome.measure: rhIGF-1 Doses Required to Achieve the Serum IGF-1 Targets With Measures Taken at Each Study Visit

intervention.intervention_name: rhIGF-1 (mecasermin) for a period of 86 weeks

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Chronological age ≥ 3
- Chronological age or bone age ≤ 12 for boys and ≤ 11 for girls
- Prepubertal at Visit 1
- Height SD score of < -2
- IGF-1 SD score of < -2
Exclusion Criteria:
- Prior treatment with GH, IGF-1, or other growth-influencing medications
- Growth failure associated with other identifiable causes (e.g., syndromes, chromosomal abnormality)
- Chronic illness such as diabetes, cystic fibrosis, etc.

participant_flow.recruitment_details: First Subject Screened: 12 January 2005. Last Subject Completed: 14 January 2009. 12 investigators screened subjects, 1 did not enroll any subject. 89 subjects were screened, 41 were ineligible, 3 declined treatment and 45 were treated and analyzed.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Screening consisted of two-staged clinic visits for up to 6 weeks, and included the following evaluations: medical history, complete physical examination, measurements of serum IGF-1 and IGF-1 binding proteins (IGFBP 1, IGFBP 2 and IGFBP-3), GH binding protein, Acid-labile subunit, GH stimulation test.

group.title: rhIGF-1 QD
group.description: During the treatment phase, subjects received subcutaneous (SC) injections of rhIGF-1 at an initial dose of 60 µg/kg QD, with subsequent dose adjustments made in order to achieve the target serum IGF-1 concentration for the subject’s age and sex.

group.title: rhIGF-1 QD
group.description: During the treatment phase, subjects received subcutaneous (SC) injections of rhIGF-1 at an initial dose of 60 µg/kg QD, with subsequent dose adjustments made in order to achieve the target serum IGF-1 concentration for the subject’s age and sex.

outcome.title: Height Velocity Over the Study Period 0 - 34 Weeks [Intent to Treat Population]
outcome.description: Height to be measured standing without shoes as the average of three measurements by the same observer using identical technique with a Harpenden or other wall mounted stadiometer. Reposition subject between each measurement.
outcome.population: The ITT principle was used for the primary analysis, with imputation of missing height velocity and missing height SD score.
